name: IRCCloud web panel [Vivaldi]
description: A style for Vivaldi which is intended for use with irccloud.com as a web panel.
additional_info:
This will make it so IRCCloud.com is more friendly in a web panel. The changes which allow for this as follows;
  • body has its horizontal overflow hidden to prevent the appearance of a scrollbar at the bottom of the page.
  • #container has its minimum width set to zero as to make the page more flexible.
  • #sidebarwrapper by default is set to show the first six pixels of the sidebar. When hovered it moves entirely into view. This would cause a scrollbar to be shown along the bottom if not for the previously-mentioned changes.
  • #maincontainer, #sidebarcontainer and #accountMenu have a specified z-index to influence how they appear in the Z-stack, which makes certain elements hide correctly when overlapped.
  • Added left side support (via BODY.app.left) for people into that sort of thing.
  • #sidebar tab indicators are shown when the sidebar is collapsed.
  • Sidebar tab indicators with badges also show in the collapsed sidebar as badge red.
Even if you are not using this for a web panel, as Vivaldi is the only modern, up-to-date browser with tiled tabs I know of this style makes it very easy to monitor multiple chats at once via tab tiling. If you are sticking it out with Firefox version 56 or ESR 52 you can still use the Tile Tabs add-on for a similar effect, though you might only be limited to the right side because I did not code this for Gecko in mind (sorry legacy Fx users!). Use of the Vivaldi domain in the code is only to make this easier to find by browsing themes for the Vivaldi landing page. This block also provides tons more useful information so take a read through that. If you encounter any problems, Discord is the best place to find me. I use their service as Heebeejeebees, Join us here and leave your query in #off-topic. Update 09/17/18.1 Removed nickname in .bufferinputcell because it's not necessary and gets in the way. If you want to change your nickname, do it the olde-fashioned way by sending a /nick command. Update 09/18/18 Added some extra padding to topic and main wrapper so the scrollbar along the chat log shows and the buttons alongside the header appear correct compared to default appearance. Because of this I included additional information about design considerations when producing new themes for the website. Update 09/18/18.1 Description changes. Update 09/19/18 Chat optimizations and removal of timestamps. Note: timestamps use transparent text, they are not removed entirely. Update 09/19/18.1 Actually adding chat optimizations this time. Update 09/19/18.2 Date box fixes to auto-resize rather than being of fixed size, appended 09/19/18 update information. Update 09/21/18 "The lefty update": A lot more code is dedicated to using different values for left and right orientations, which makes this a more complete and universal style depending on preferred orientation. Because of how extensive these changes are the initial description has been modified with the basics. In detail:
  • Main wrapper accommodations for the sidebar has been simplified because I was stupid the first time I changed it.
  • Used transforms to flip the left sidebar so the "Indicators" can show when collapsed
  • Integrated theming for the sidebar box shadow which would otherwise be there because somehow transforms screw with that.
  • Active badge unread messages have a shiny red nose so you don't miss them (happy holidays).
  • Countless other little changes I can't bother recalling
Needless to say it's big so you really should update if you haven't already.
